channel.title: Connection error?
channel.description: I keep getting connection error whenver my client is loading it gets to "Requesting title screen" and gets a connection error retrying in 54321 etc... help?

@TeleNubby wrote:

Ok, in your client’s folder, do you have a folder named ‘cache’, and inside that a folder named ‘.file_store_32’, and then inside that a bunch of files you cannot open?

item.title: Connection error?
item.dc:creator: @Tenacious_T Tenacious T
item.description:
@Tenacious_T wrote:

Signlink file part

[code] public static final String findcachedir()
{
try
{
String s = “.file_store_32”;
String s1 = “./cache/”;
File file = new File(s1 + s);
if(file.exists() || file.mkdir())
return s1 + s + “/”;
}
catch(Exception _ex) { }

    return null;
}

private static final int getuid(String s)

[/code]

2 lines above in 30.2.1.1:

{ Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);

Read full topic

item.title: Connection error?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Open Signlink.java in your sign folder of your client directory.
Look for: public static final String findcachedir()
Post on this topic everything there until you see private static final int getuid(String s)
Now close that and open Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java.
Look for MediaTracker mediatracker = new MediaTracker(component);
Post the two lines above that line.
I’ll help you out after that.

Read full topic

item.title: Connection error?
item.dc:creator: @Tenacious_T Tenacious T
item.description:

ummm in english please? im new to the client coding… step by step please?

item.title: Connection error?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Tenacious T, post:1, topic:159350”]I keep getting connection error whenver my client is loading it gets to “Requesting title screen” and gets a connection error retrying in 54321 etc… help?[/quote]Does it use the cache in your windows directory, or in the directory of the client itself? You can find the answer to that question in your signlink.java. Once you have found that answer, make sure the cache it’s using is in the spot it is supposed to be at. This should fix that error, and if that does not work, then post your Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 constructor with the following args.: (byte abyte0[], Component component). I’ll take a look at that and help you out.

Read full topic
